description: Last month in Bangladesh, street protests grew into a movement that eventually ended the rule of the autocratic prime minister. Now the country is picking up the pieces and charting a new way forward. We board a double-decker bus in Bangladesh's capital, Dhaka, to talk to Bangladeshis about the future.
title: Seeing a Changed Bangladesh from a Double-Decker Bus

description: As the investigation continues, the 14-year-old student who is accused of killing four people and injuring nine others at the Winder, Ga., high school is scheduled for a court appearance Friday.
title: Apalachee High School shooting suspect is charged with 4 counts of murder

description: Congo has over 20,000 cases of mpox and hundreds of deaths mostly in children but until now, zero vaccines.  A plane load of doses donated from the EU landed in Kinshasa Thursday.
title: First doses of mpox vaccines arrive at the heart of Africa's outbreak.  What took so long?

description: In a hearing marked by moments of tension and humor, Trump and Justice Department lawyers clashed over how the federal election interference case against the former president should proceed.
title: Trump lawyers, special counsel fight over election interference case in court

description: Experts on school violence say a key to preventing such tragedies is identifying and supporting students in crisis before they hurt others.
title: What research says about preventing school shootings

description: Just one month into the school year, four people were ripped away from their loved ones, their lives ended by a mass shooting at Apalachee High School in Winder, Ga.
title: These are the 2 students and 2 teachers killed at Apalachee High School in Georgia

description: New Yorker writer David Kirkpatrick says anti-fascists are using extra judicial methods to do what the FBI can't, by infiltrating white nationalist groups to expose them and planned attacks.
title: Why anti-fascist vigilantes are infiltrating far-right white nationalist groups

description: Members of the Democratic Women's Caucus are urging the FDA to address concerns about the safety and regulation of tampons after a study found heavy metals, including lead, in many popular products.
title: After a study found toxic metals in tampons, lawmakers are pressing the FDA to act

description: The appointment ends 50 days of caretaker government, but the choice has already angered left wing lawmakers, who say the conservative Barnier  won't get a majority backing in the National Assembly.
title: France's Macron names EU's Brexit negotiator Michel Barnier as prime minister

description: The pope’s meeting with the Muslim leader in Jakarta comes during the first leg of an intense 11-day, four-nation tour in Asia and Oceania.
title: Pope Francis and Indonesia’s top imam make a joint call for religious harmony

description: Every year at summer's end, volunteers in New York illuminate historic fire towers on mountain summits, honoring fire watchers who keep communities safe in the Adirondack and Catskill Mountains.
title: Fire towers in New York are illuminated to honor fire watchers who kept communities safe

description: The FBI released new details about the boy accused of deadly shooting at Apalachee High in Georgia. And, two RT employees charged for scheme to spread Kremlin propaganda before November election.
title: Details on Georgia school shooting suspect. And, Russian media hired U.S. influencers

description: Rebecca Cheptegei, who was 33, had competed at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. She died from organ failure after being set on fire by a man local authorities described as Cheptegei's partner.
title: Ugandan Olympic athlete dies after being severely burned in gasoline attack

description: The sordid details of one of the darkest periods of Hunter Biden's life could be dredged up in a trial over tax evasion that kicks off on Thursday.
title: Hunter Biden goes on trial in Los Angeles over charges of tax evasion

description: Lawyers for the government's special counsel and former President Donald Trump are set to clash in court in Washington over how the election interference case against him will proceed.
title: Trump Jan. 6 case gets its first hearing since the Supreme Court's immunity ruling

description: It's September, and many college students are arriving on campus for the first time. This exciting new chapter can have a darker side: College students are considered a high-risk group for drugging.
title: Worried about your drink getting spiked? Here are some safety tips

description: Reporters for NPR traveled across North and South Dakota to see the challenges older adults in rural areas face when they need medical care — and to see what it's like for the people trying to help.
title: Photos: How older adults navigate their health care needs in rural America

description: California could become the first state to require technology in cars that warns drivers when they're going 10 miles per hour over the speed limit. But critics say lawmakers are moving too fast.
title: Should your car warn you that you’re speeding? California lawmakers vote yes

description: Chinese particle physicist Yangyang Cheng reflects on the legacy of the late Nobel laureate T.D. Lee — how his ideas changed her life, and the limit to his engagement with Beijing.
title: T.D. Lee changed science in China and my life. This is what I owe to him

description: Vice presidential nominee Tim Walz went from being endorsed by the NRA to a fierce advocate for gun control. That evolution reflects a larger shift that has been happening within the Democratic Party over the last decade.
title: Tim Walz's NRA rating went from A to F. It's part of a shift from Democrats on guns

description: Jessica Pegula is seeded No. 6 and Emma Navarro is seeded No. 13. Both women are New York natives.
title: 2 American women are playing in the U.S. Open women's singles semifinals

description:
From the beginning of her career, Grammy-winning musician Kacey Musgraves has been doing what feels authentic to herself. She sings about familiar country themes like falling in love and heartbreak. But she also sings about smoking pot and queer relationships. Musgraves talks to Rachel about not being defined by anyone but herself, becoming more open-minded and living with the ghost of her grandma.

To listen sponsor-free, access bonus episodes and support the show, sign up for Wild Card+ at plus.npr.org/wildcard
title: Kacey Musgraves says a past boyfriend helped her become more accepting
